page.title: 19Rolls Royce near Brinklow
page.content: Rolls Royce Ltd. produces Industrial and Marine Engines and Gas Turbines. The equipment ordered by customers consists of gas turbines for generating water power,pumping gas and for compression on off-shore rigs. At present most orders come from abroad. Some research and development work is carried out but is mostly on a country wide basis.The present site covers and area of approximately 311 acres and the number of people employed there is 2,300.The workforce is drawn from an area stretching from as far as Birmingham and Leicester.Most employees,however,are from Coventry, Nuneaton and Rugby.Transport is provided.In 1936 the site accommodated Service Training Ltd.and was also used as an Air Training School during the war.Also Air Speed Oxford aircraft were made for the Standard Motor Co.
